metadata.Title: CVE-2023-0216 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: An invalid pointer dereference on read can be triggered when an application tries to load malformed PKCS7 data with the d2i_PKCS7(), d2i_PKCS7_bio() or d2i_PKCS7_fp() functions. The result of the dereference is an application crash which could lead to a denial of service attack. The TLS implementation in OpenSSL does not call this function however third party applications might call these functions on untrusted data.

criterions.comment: edk2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
openssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
